page.title: 01THE PENTIRE/CRANTOCK AREA
page.content:
This is a coastal area dependent on Tourism & Farming. Pentire headland is an extension of{Newquay,}with many hotels and some expensive housing on the southern edge overlooking the{ {River Gannel. }The area to the south of the Gannel is farmland with{ {Crantock}village and the hamlet of West Pentire. There are 3 farms, which also run seasonal Camp Sites, and 2 Caravan Parks. The coastline, cliffs and estuary are the dominant features with Fistral and Crantock, both large sandy beaches, while Porth Joke is smaller and less accessible
Fistral and Pentire are managed by the Local Council while the estuary, and southward to include Kelsey Head, is managed by the National Trust. Much of the land is owned by the Duchy of Cornwall.
